link.synopsis: Emmy Award winner Sid Caesar leads an all-star cast in this classic screwball comedy as George Norton, a blundering mob yes-man charged with retrieving a stash of money that has been sewn into the lining of a dead man's suit. Based on a novel by Donald E. Westlake and directed by William Castle, the comedy of errors also stars Anne Baxter, Robert Ryan, Dom DeLuise and Richard Pryor, in his first appearance on the big screen.

link.synopsis: Members of British comedy troupe the Crazy Gang are hapless fish-and-chips vendors who find themselves accidentally transported, via barrage balloon, across the Channel and trapped behind enemy lines in this wartime comedy. The Nazis capture the men, who soon devise an outrageous plan of escape that involves tunnels and impersonating Adolph Hitler. Walter Ford and Marcel Varnel co-direct this film that stars Bud Flanagan and Chesney Allen.

link.synopsis: Funnyman Bert Kreischer -- who did time in Disney jail, entered a birthing room after dropping acid and was dubbed "the number-one party animal in the nation" by Rolling Stone -- shares his unique take on life in this uproarious comedy concert. Helmed by actor-turned-director Vijay Patkar (Chashmebahhadar), this spirited comedy features a screenplay by Hemant Edlabadkar and also stars Pragnya Jadhav and Gauri Kendre.

link.synopsis: Comedian Jim Breuer, "Saturday Night Live" alum and satellite radio personality, is back for a night of side-splitting laughter as he clears the air on life, family and career in this stand-up comedy special. Goat Boy and Half Baked aside, Breuer chronicles his experiences from childhood to family man with hilarious anecdotes and insights in a routine that proves why he's one of Comedy Central's 100 Greatest Stand-ups of All Time.

link.synopsis: When work-averse pals Theo (Matt Silver) and Terrance (Darren Curtis) are stymied in their bid for fame and fortune, they decide to hustle their way to the top by having a disguised Terrance impersonate KK Downey, the hero of Theo's novel about a junkie prostitute. KK quickly becomes a cult icon, and Theo and Terrance deal with the unexpected consequences of fame. Montreal comedy troupe Kidnapper Films skewers modern celebrity in this quirky indie comedy.

link.synopsis: When their record label drops them, rock musician Dan Stone (Tyler Christopher) and his band pull the ultimate publicity stunt, but love gets in the way of fame and fortune in this romantic comedy. The band fakes Dan's death, but when a cute reporter (Elena Lyons) begins investigating the situation, the rock star wanna-be must decide whether to continue to hide out or to come clean and win the girl. Patrick Malone and Ted McGinley co-star.

link.synopsis: This charmingly offbeat film deftly melds two genres -- comedy and sci-fi thriller -- as it recounts the misfortunes of Lloyd (David Fickas), a neurotic conspiracy theorist who's in a self-imposed funk because he fears the world is out to get him. Hoping to help the delusional man, Traci (Mo Gaffney), Lloyd's neighbor and childhood friend, at first tries to humor him but winds up thinking his paranoia may be based in truth.

link.synopsis: In this risqué, rollicking 1960s sex farce from Britain, slimy skirt-chaser Tolen (Ray Brooks) tries to give his straitlaced landlord, timid schoolteacher Colin (the perfectly cast Michael Crawford), a tip or two about how to make it with the ladies -- with riotously funny results. Rita Tushingham is hilarious as their wide-eyed, innocent target. A swift, smart comedy adapted from the play by Ann Jellicoe.

link.synopsis: Lonely Mikey (Katt Williams) -- a short, bike-riding burger flipper -- doesn't seem to have much going for him. That is, until he enters the world of online dating, where he describes himself as a 7-foot-tall L.A. Lakers basketball player. His profile wins many admirers, but his luck seems to run out quickly whenever he meets the ladies in the flesh. Rap impresario Master P directs this romantic dot-comedy starring Lil' Romeo and Clifton Powell.

link.synopsis: In this granddaddy of teen sex comedies, five randy young males given high school detention decide to get even with the oh-so-popular girl who squealed on them and landed them in trouble: Purity Busch (Linda Speciale). Their plan is to deflower her, but when they fail, the boys enlist the aid of the entire school hoping that someone will get the deed done at the homecoming game. Peter Keleghan and Linda Shayne also star.

link.synopsis: Talented and genuinely upstanding locksmith Ernest (Charlie Drake) can open just about anything, but unfortunately his stubborn and gullible nature lands him in prison -- twice -- where he struggles to stay out of trouble and clear his name. This slapstick comedy finds Ernest quickly gaining an unwanted reputation as a master thief and inadvertently becoming an integral part of a major jewel heist.

link.synopsis: Factory worker Jean Vereecken (Josse De Pauw) dreams that his chubby daughter, Marva (Eva van der Gucht), will become a star, even after she performs disastrously in a local singing competition. One day, Jean seizes a golden opportunity, kidnapping pop diva Debbie (Thekla Reuten) and demanding that her manager give Marva a shot at stardom. Dominique Deruddere directs this upbeat comedy, which received an Oscar nod for Best Foreign Language Film.

link.synopsis: During World War II, a young woman (Goldie Hawn) takes a Rosie the Riveter-type job on a home-front factory assembly line while her husband is away defending democracy. Directed by Jonathan Demme, this is the comedy that began Kurt Russell and Hawn's longtime real-life relationship. The all-star cast lineup includes Charles Napier, Christine Lahti, Ed Harris, Fred Ward, Holly Hunter and Lisa Pelikan.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee

link.synopsis: It's a case of culture clash when a warrior finds himself a few thousand miles -- and 900 years -- from home. Count Thibault of Malfete (Jean Reno) is transported from 12th-century France to a modern Chicago museum. There, he meets the beautiful Julia (Christina Applegate), a descendant of his. The problem is, if he doesn't get back to his own time, she'll never be born. Jean-Marie Poiré directs this remake of his 1993 comedy Les Visiteurs.
link.title: synopsis
Jack and the Beanstalk: The Real Story
Crimson Rivers 2: Angels of the Apocalypse
The Magical Legend of the Leprechauns
InuYasha: The Movie: Affections Touching Across Time

link.synopsis: Robert Altman delivers an uproarious look at Buffalo Bill Cody (Paul Newman), the legendary Western adventurer who turned his celebrity into cash with the creation of a Wild West sideshow. Based on the stage play by Arthur Kopit, this cheeky comedy presents a biting critique of American history, co-starring Joel Grey, Shelley Duvall, Burt Lancaster, Harvey Keitel and Pat McCormick as President Grover Cleveland.

link.synopsis: In this entertaining 1960s comedy, Rock Hudson plays Roger Willoughby, a fishing gear salesman for Abercrombie & Fitch who's ordered by his boss to participate in a fishing competition. There's only one problem: Roger's never worked a rod and reel in his life! But he goes along with the charade, until he meets the beautiful Abigail Page (Paula Prentiss) ... and becomes involved in a sport of a very different kind.

Has Anybody Seen My Gal? / A Very Special Favor
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!

link.synopsis: Culled from the sexy cable series "Click," this lusty comedy follows the exploits of an archaeologist (John La Zar) who recovers a unique relic that endows its owner with the power to turn anyone into a push-button sex maniac. But he loses the arousing artifact after unintentionally using it on a hotel maid and soon finds himself frantically scouring the globe for it. Leigh Ann Garrett, Jacqueline Lovell and Kim Dawson also star.

link.synopsis: Former monk Juvenal (Skeet Ulrich) returns to Los Angeles after many years away and begins work at a rehab center, where he discovers stigmata on his palms and a miraculous gift for healing. As word gets out, con man Bill Hill (Christopher Walken) sends his accomplice, Lynn Faulkner (Bridget Fonda), to infiltrate Juvenal's world and find out whether he's the real deal. Of course, she falls for him. This comedy is based on a novel by Elmore Leonard.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Jon Aldrich (Tom Selleck) lives the good life: He has a stunning home, a fantastic job and a beautiful wife (Christine Ebersole) and children. But when his folks (Don Ameche and Anne Jackson) move in with him, Jon's ideal life crumbles and before long, he's starting to lose everything -- including his mind. Jon's house and spouse go away, and his assets are frozen during an investigation. But that's just the tip of the iceberg in this madcap comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Vince Vaughn's Wild West Comedy Show

The Brady Bunch in the White House
Three Men and a Little Lady

link.synopsis: One of the comedy show's favorite hosts, this compilation presents Oscar-winning actor Tom Hanks in some of his most notable "SNL" skits -- from spoofing his films Big and Cast Away to portraying inimitable characters such as Mr. Short-Term Memory. This collection of gems includes Hanks being inducted into the "Five Timers Club," along with other frequent hosts Steve Martin, Elliott Gould and Paul Simon.

link.synopsis: In this quirky comedy about two aspiring filmmakers, sci-fi geeks Mark (Eric McCormack) and Rob (Rafer Weigel) are nearing 30 and still prefer action figures to women. When they bump into a pathetic, middle-aged William Shatner, they resolve to change their juvenile existence. Shatner, bent on staging a one-man musical about Julius Caesar, isn't exactly an inspiration to them. When Rob finally finds romance, will Mark be left behind?

You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
How William Shatner Changed the World
The Night of the White Pants
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: Shirley Temple sparkles in this musical comedy about an orphan who fights to remain with her beloved guardian, a kind old lighthouse keeper, when authorities get wind of the girl's living situation. Star (Temple) lives happily with Capt. January (Guy Kibbee), but her life takes an unexpected turn when beastly truant officer Agatha Morgan (Sara Haden) decides Star should be removed from the captain's home and placed in a boarding school.
link.title: synopsis
Shirley Temple: The Biggest Little Star

link.synopsis: Old-fashioned values collide with the whims of youth in this modern romantic comedy about a dutiful Chinese-Canadian daughter who wants to please her parents without sacrificing part of herself when it comes to love. Deep down, Jade (Sandra Oh) knows her mother and father won't approve of her new boyfriend, a white college student named Mark (Callum Keith Rennie). But that doesn't stop her from hoping for "double happiness."
link.title: synopsis
Dim Sum: A Little Bit of Heart

link.synopsis: Silver screen icon Ava Gardner stars in this charming romantic comedy as a statue of the Roman goddess of love, Anatolian Venus, who is magically brought to life by a harmless kiss from a lonely, young window dresser named Eddie Hatch (Robert Walker). Nothing but trouble ensues! Elia Kazan produces and William A. Seiter directs this enchanting tale based on Kurt Weill and Ogden Nash's popular stage musical from 1945.
link.title: synopsis
The Luck of the Irish / I'll Never Forget You
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend

link.synopsis: Outraged that exorbitant property taxes may drive widow Grace Jackson (Millie King) from her home, young moviemakers John (John R. Moore) and Cameron (Cameron Heidrick) set out to win a major film festival by making a musical Western that draws attention to her plight. An adventure comedy rooted in the teachings of Jesus Christ, this inspirational tale also stars Angela Coates, Colin Gunn and Gator Moore.

link.synopsis: From multi-hyphenate extraordinaire Tyler Perry comes this hilarious and warm family comedy about Curtis (LaVan Davis) and Ella Payne (Cassi Davis), whose hospitality are tested when their nephew C.J. (Allen Payne) moves into their crowded Atlanta home with his large family. Fire Chief Curtis likes to think he's large and in charge, but Ella whittles him down to size while keeping the rest of her brood in line, including son Calvin (Lance Gross).

link.synopsis: Hilarity finds a home in the most unlikely of places -- a World War II German POW camp -- in this 1960s comedy series. Bob Crane stars as Col. Robert Hogan, an irascible wise guy who leads his fellow prisoners in a variety of mad escape plots. The butts of the jokes are the starched-stiff Germans, particularly Col. Wilhelm Klink (Werner Klemperer), whose exasperated cry of "Hogan!" became one of the show's many repeatable catch phrases.

link.synopsis: Undead slackers Mike and Brent are reborn as part of a major zombie outbreak in this gore-happy comedy that also serves as a love story. While searching for Mike's missing fiance, the two monster pals find themselves quarry for bounty hunters.

Citizen Toxie: The Toxic Avenger IV

link.synopsis: All bets are off when the toughest team in the Sunday Soccer League goes up against a flamboyant gay team in this high-energy comedy. While the tough guys are close to being kicked out of the league for violence, the gay team must prove their mettle.
link.title: synopsis
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

In the Hands of the Gods

link.synopsis: This comedy follows the bumpy saga of Fitz, a pot dealer and rock musician who skips town after one of his deals goes awry. Unfortunately, Fitz and his 16-year-old sidekick only find their way into even deeper trouble.

link.synopsis: Roscoe "Fatty" Arbuckle's comic genius and "Buster" Keaton's impeccable timing shine through in this collection of short films, which includes "The Butcher Boy," "The Bell Boy," "Out West," "Moonshine" and "The Hayseed." Though Arbuckle later became embroiled in scandal, in his heyday he reigned as one of the kings of silent slapstick and forever altered the face of cinematic comedy when he teamed with the up-and-coming Keaton.

link.synopsis: Silent comedy icon Fatty Arbuckle made a great career move when he plucked a young performer named Buster Keaton from the world of vaudeville and placed him in his movies, including The Bell Boy and Out West, which are featured in this collection. Whether poking fun at cowboy Western films, rival comedian Charlie Chaplin or himself, Arbuckle always shows a willingness to do anything to get a laugh.

link.synopsis: Police Lt. Diamond (Cornel Wilde) is obsessed with nabbing the notorious Mr. Brown (Richard Conte), a man he's suspected of wrongdoing for years yet has never been able to snare. But Brown's beautiful blond girlfriend (Jean Wallace), a woman with shadowy desires, is an equally tempting target. Joseph H. Lewis directs this low-budget film noir that raised the eyebrows of 1950s censors with frank suggestions of sadomasochism.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: The lives of three friends unfold against the dramatic backdrop of Chechnya's struggle for independence. Opening with footage of the three young men enjoying a night out on the town in Grozny, filmmaker Masha Novikova guides us through their personal tragedies as the war develops. One of the friends, Ramzan Mezidov, was a photographer for Grozny TV during the war, and his rare, revealing footage is presented here.

link.synopsis: In this finely acted ensemble drama from director Robert Altman, the members of a 1950s James Dean fan club gather in the tiny town of McCarthy, Texas, for a reunion. As the ladies arrive, the film alternates between past and present. Revealed are stunning secrets and exposed is the gulf between the women's dreams and reality. Sandy Dennis, Cher (whose performance garnered a Golden Globe nomination), Karen Black and Kathy Bates star.

link.synopsis: When a trio of hapless small-town kids head to the big city in search of adventure, they accidentally check themselves into a mental institution -- mistaking it for a motel -- and fall into the clutches of two maniacal doctors. Alfonso Zayas and Maribel Fernández star as the not-so-sane psychiatrists who just so happen to be looking for human guinea pigs. This madcap Mexican comedy also features Claudia del Valle, Diana Herrera and Eduardo Zayas.

link.synopsis: In this romantic comedy, bookish biologist Simon lusts after a beauty who barely knows he exists. Against the advice of a womanizing friend, Simon decides to make her jealous by dating his lab partner. But every part of Simon's plan falls apart.
link.title: synopsis
A Home at the End of the World

link.synopsis: This riotous compilation of 1930s comedy shorts contains Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy's "Be Big" and "The Stolen Jools," in which the slapstick clowns appear with an all-star cast that includes Edward G. Robinson, Buster Keaton and Norma Shearer. Other films on the DVD: the Our Gang (aka Little Rascals) comedies "Our Gang Follies of 1938," "School's Out" and "Bear Shooters," plus "Whispering Whoopee" starring Charley Chase and Thelma Todd.

link.synopsis: This incredibly popular Bollywood comedy has become the benchmark for Indian comedies since the film's 1996 release. Karthik tries to pull a "Joe Millionaire" to win himself the lovely Rambha. But when the ruse is up, he still may get the girl -- on musical talent alone! The songs  "I Love You Love You" and "Azhagiya Laila" topped the charts after the film's release.

link.synopsis: Cedric the Entertainer hosts and stars in this wacky variety series that takes its cue from the big comedy-variety shows of the 1950s. Cedric presides over a team of actors, comedy performers and the "Cedsation Dancers," delivering a fast-paced and funny show that includes such characters as "The Love Doctor," "Mrs. Cafeteria Lady" and "Raj," a hapless golf commentator. Wendy Raquel Robinson, Shaun Majumder and Amy Brassette co-star.

Among the shorts are the political comedies "You Natzy Spy!" and "I'll Never Heil Again," in which the hapless half-wits brilliantly mock the Third Reich and the Axis powers of World War II.

link.synopsis: Iranian filmmaker Parisa Bakhtavar's comedy centers on pretty-but-poor Shirin (Baran Kosari), who, after wrecking her father's car, teams up with her friend, Mohammad (Saber Abbar), in a money-making scheme selling bootleg videos to residents of a ritzy condo complex. Their attempt to make fast money to keep Shirin out of trouble leads them into madcap situations reminiscent of classic screwball comedies from Billy Wilder and Preston Sturges.

link.synopsis: Get a whopping dose of dark humor down in the hamlet of Royston Vasey in this outrageously macabre BBC sketch-comedy/sitcom hybrid, which showcases a three-man comedy troupe (Mark Gatiss, Reece Shearsmith and Steve Pemberton) portraying dozens of peculiar characters who call the village home. Among the locals who torment one another and visitors in equal measure are a wicked circus ringmaster and a veteran with a lethal power over animals.

link.synopsis: Nine-year-old Thelma (Cassie Barasch) has learned a few things from her larcenous next-door neighbor (John Hurt), such as how to blackmail him and his mistress (Karen Young). But when her crime spree turns into stealing their gun and committing murder, things spiral out of control. With both sides holding each other hostage, there's no way this arrangement will end peacefully. Ellie Raab co-stars in this pitch-black comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Director Peter Watkins tells the story of the historic Paris Commune of 1871, whose members formed a spontaneous revolutionary government to challenge the established order during the Franco-Prussian War. The docudrama re-creates the events, inserting dueling modern-day camera crews to tell both sides of this important moment in history, one following the revolutionary movement, the other bowing to the official party version.

The Sixth Side of the Pentagon / The Embassy

link.synopsis: While spending the summer living with her father (Stuart G. Bennett) and the creepy members of his dysfunctional commune, beautiful and virginal teenager Jenny Cross (Chauntal Lewis) discovers that she's at the center of a frightfully sinister ritual and tries desperately to escape. Written, directed and co-starring Elisabeth Fies, this disturbing psychological thriller also stars David Lago, Adrian Lee and Cindy Baer.
link.title: synopsis
My Son, My Son, What Have Ye Done
Twin Peaks: Fire Walk With Me

link.synopsis: In the early days of the Civil War, a tall and likable Texan (John Wayne) defeats the local schoolteacher (Walter Pidgeon) to become the new Kansas City marshal. But when they clash again over the love of the town beauty (Claire Trevor), the sheriff has an outlaw on his hands. Now, he must stop the ex-educator's renegade band of guerrillas from wreaking havoc on the surrounding territory in the name of the Confederacy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Exiled to a branch office for six weeks, two white-collar middle managers (Matt Malloy and Aaron Eckhart, in his breakout role) come up with a way to kill time: Find an insecure woman, independently romance her and then simultaneously dump her to squelch her self-esteem. Writer-director Neil LaBute's powerful, amoral look at office politics and sexual gamesmanship is guaranteed to push buttons with its searing, cruel candor.
link.title: synopsis
The Cook, The Thief, His Wife, and Her Lover

link.synopsis: Director Douglas Barr examines the dark side of genetic research in this made-for-TV thriller. Distraught by the drowning death of their only child, the infertile Westons, Skye (Elizabeth Perkins) and Rick (Bradley Whitford), may get a second chance at parenthood after Skye discovers that their son was cloned. Although the couple desperately wants another child, Skye senses something disturbing in the works and begins to investigate.
link.title: synopsis
Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip: The Complete Series
The Man in the Iron Mask

link.synopsis: Melvin Van Peebles's comedy-drama centers on white-bread racist Jeff Gerber (Godfrey Cambridge), who's doing just fine as long as the blacks don't move in and ruin his neighborhood. But Jeff's bigoted world is rocked when his skin unexplainably turns dark overnight. Now shunned by white people, Jeff begins to see the light with help from some new black friends.

The Story of a Three-Day Pass

How to Eat Your Watermelon in White Company (And Enjoy It)

link.synopsis: Sandra Dee takes the lead in two sequels to 1957's hit Tammy and the Bachelor. In Tammy Tell Me True, our heroine pilots her houseboat downriver to be near her boyfriend, who's at college. In Tammy and the Doctor, Tammy takes a job as a nurse's aide. Peter Fonda co-stars as the handsome young doctor she falls for. These films were eventually followed by 1967's Tammy and the Millionaire, which completed the Tammy series of romantic comedies.
link.title: synopsis
Gidget Goes Hawaiian / Gidget Goes to Rome

How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life / Who Was That Lady?

title.short: Tammy Tell Me True / Tammy and the Doctor

link.synopsis: Based on Truman Capote's nonfiction novel of the same name and filmed in the house where the real-life incident occurred, this chilling tale follows two drifters (Robert Blake and Scott Wilson) who allegedly murder a rich Kansas family and flee to Mexico. Nominated for four Oscars, this disturbing black-and-white movie paints a compassionate portrait of the Clutter family ... and their killers. John Forsythe also stars.
link.title: synopsis
The Killing of a Chinese Bookie
Cat on a Hot Tin Roof

link.synopsis: In this comedy tinged with pathos, love blossoms amid the confusion and despair of Nazareth, a city caught in the crossfire of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. Elia Suleiman (who directed the film) stars as E.S., a man who observes the ravages of war alongside his girlfriend (Manal Khader). Surreal vignettes underscore the war's ability to erode this city's sense of community and its residents' ability to coexist.
link.title: synopsis
Ali Zaoua: Prince of the Streets

link.synopsis: Prolific disc jockey and concert producer Alan Freed is the guy they say discovered rock 'n' roll -- which has roots in jazz, blues and gospel -- and this is the saga behind his history-making mark on the world. Ex-boxer Rocky Graziano and Fisher & Marks, the nightclub comedy duo, add laughs. Watch for appearances by Chuck Berry, Little Richard, Frankie Lymon and the Teenagers, Clyde McPhatter, Frankie Lymon, the Moonglows and Lionel Hampton.
link.title: synopsis
Rock & Roll Hall of Fame: The 25th Anniversary Concerts
Frank Sinatra Show: Welcome Home Elvis
Why Do Fools Fall in Love
Johnny Cash and Roscoe Holcombe: Rainbow Quest
Country Music Classics: Marty Robbins and Ernest Tubb
Pete Best: Best of the Beatles
Jayne Mansfield Collection: The Girl Can't Help It

link.synopsis: Chander (Mithun Chakraborty) is the head of security in a weapons factory who discovers a plot to sell arms to international terrorists. When he takes his findings to the top executives, Chander realizes they're in on the deal, and he becomes a marked man on the run. Attempting to find the center of the conspiracy, Chander uses his military training to survive the assassins on his trail. Shakti Kapoor and Mandakini co-star.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: The inimitable Danny Kaye stars as famed storyteller Hans Christian Andersen in this charming fictionalized biopic that blends music, romance, comedy and fantasy to trace the life of Denmark's literary hero. A small-town shoemaker with a knack for spinning yarns, the eventual author of such classic fairy tales as "The Ugly Duckling" and "Thumbelina" encounters happiness and heartbreak on his road to becoming a full-fledged writer.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: New Yorker Eliza D'Amico (Hope Davis) drags along her mother, father, sister, and sister's boyfriend to Manhattan to confront her husband, Louis (Stanley Tucci), who she thinks is two-timing her after she finds what appears to be a love letter to him from a woman named Sandy. Greg Mottola writes and directs this intelligent indie comedy, which also stars Anne Meara, Pat McNamara, Parker Posey and Liev Schreiber.
link.title: synopsis
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: Written by Tennessee Williams, this black comedy tells the story of cotton gin owner Archie (Karl Malden) and his sexy teenage wife (Carroll Baker), who won't consummate the marriage until she turns 20. When Archie battles a rival (Eli Wallach), he could lose his business -- and his bride. Baker earned an Oscar nod, and director Elia Kazan won a Golden Globe for his steamy and, at the time of its release, controversial film.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: After being bitten by a drug-sniffing dog, mob boss Sonny Talia (Paul Sorvino) marks the canine for a hit in director John Whitesell's comedy. The FBI's solution? Put the dog, Agent 11, into a witness protection program -- with goofy, dog-hating mailman Gordon (David Arquette) as the guardian. But Agent 11 has plans to escape and get back to his job. After all, it has to be easy to outwit a slob of a postman and two professional hit men.
link.title: synopsis
The Cave of the Yellow Dog
Dr. Dolittle: Tail to the Chief
Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son
The Man Who Knew Too Little

link.synopsis: Girl power turns their families and the city upside down in this warm, fun and witty comedy as 12-year-old best friends Frankie (Mischa Barton) and Hazel (Ingrid Uribe) conspire to make their mark on the local community. One excels at ballet and baseball and battles a sexist coach for a spot on a Little League team, while the other devours politics and decides to run for mayor.
link.title: synopsis
Free Willy 4: Escape from Pirate's Cove

link.synopsis: When Miss Charming Jones (Ann-Margret) goes to pick up a large sum of money from her father, the greedy Avery Simpson decides he wants that money and hires a clumsy old cowboy, Cactus Jack (Kirk Douglas), to rob Charming as she returns home in this screwball gunslinger comedy. It's Handsome Stranger (Arnold Schwarzenegger) to the rescue! Stuntman Hal Needham (Smokey and the Bandit, The Cannonball Run) directs.

link.synopsis: When Eva (Thora Birch) secretly adopts a mischievous capuchin monkey, her life turns upside down in this slapstick family comedy. Eva's mother (Mimi Rogers) and allergic stepfather (Christopher McDonald) raise objections, especially when the animal begins stealing everything in sight, but Eva is concerned about protecting her new pet from Azro (Harvey Keitel), who wants to find him and use him as part of an important robbery.
link.title: synopsis
Far from Home: The Adventures of Yellow Dog

link.synopsis: Rowan and Martin's "Laugh-In," an innovative television show from the late 1960s, popularized a style of rapid-fire sketch comedy where skits, punch lines and gags are edited together in a fast-moving and almost random format. The laughs keep on rolling as the two hosts bring on a variety of special guests including Lily Tomlin, Goldie Hawn, Arte Johnson, Henry Gibson and many others. The six episodes in this set span the years 1968-1970.

link.synopsis: An Alabama family reunites to support their Uncle Hazel (Jim Varney), who's on trial for murder. Musician Claude (Billy Bob Thornton) and his wife, Ruby (Laura Dern), are among the relatives who return, but no sooner do they unpack their bags than they get caught in a web of family infighting. Oscar winner Billy Bob Thornton writes and directs this dark comedy that co-stars Diane Ladd, Andy Griffith, Kelly Preston and Ben Affleck.

This time out, the boys take aim at Merlin's Shop of Mystical Wonders. In the film, Merlin time-travels to modern times and opens a magic shop, which serves as the backdrop for two disjointed horror tales, explained (somewhat) by a grandfather played by Ernest Borgnine.

link.synopsis: Aspiring model Brier Tucket (Pell James) takes her shot at Hollywood stardom in this romantic comedy. With the support of her agent, Carrie (Carrie Fisher), and an acting-class friend, Clea (Ashlee Simpson), Brier thinks she is definitely on her way. But when she meets struggling musician Luke (Steven Strait), she can't resist helping him out by inventing a little career-boosting publicity -- and Luke becomes the next big thing.
link.title: synopsis
Jack and Jill vs. the World
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School

link.synopsis: Screen siren Marilyn Monroe makes her last film appearance playing a wife and mother, thanks to a fascinating 37-minute reconstruction of scenes from her final film, Something's Got to Give. The romantic comedy was halted halfway through production when Marilyn was fired from the project shortly before her tragic death in 1962. The film never found its way to the big screen but was later produced under a different title starring Doris Day.
link.title: synopsis
There's No Business Like Show Business
Life with Judy Garland: Me and My Shadows
Beat the Devil / That Uncertain Feeling
I Love Lucy: The Movie and Other Great Rarities
Shemp Cocktail: A Toast to the Original Stooge
My Sister Eileen / She Wouldn't Say Yes
The Last of the Blonde Bombshells

link.synopsis: Abandoned in the desert, prospector Cable Hogue survives his ordeal when he discovers a freshwater spring. Transforming the oasis into a much needed pit stop on the local stagecoach route, the resourceful Hogue sits back to wait for his double-crossing former partners. Jason Robards shines in the title role of this lighthearted Western, a film characterized more by picaresque comedy than by director Sam Peckinpah's signature violence.
link.title: synopsis
Bring Me the Head of Alfredo Garcia
Pat Garrett and Billy the Kid
The Life and Times of Judge Roy Bean
A Big Hand for the Little Lady
The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
The Return of a Man Called Horse

link.synopsis: In his first film role, country singer Kenny Rogers stars as Brewster Baker, a retired stock-car driver who's on the comeback trail. But he finds his racing plans temporarily thwarted when six delinquent siblings (including Anthony Michael Hall and Diane Lane) strip Brewster's car to sell the parts. Reluctantly, he takes the miscreant brood under his wing -- and turns them into his new pit crew in this breezy comedy directed by Daniel Petrie.

Kenny Rogers: Coward of the County
The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas
The Christmas Season Massacre / Satan Claus / Psycho Santa

link.synopsis: In this urban comedy, Michael (Jaleel White, of "Family Matters"), a young San Diego police officer, begins to wonder whether he's marrying into a clan of crazies when he joins his fiancée's (Jennia Fredrique) family for Thanksgiving dinner. Her father, a former Black Panther, is militant to say the least, while her brother's a disrespectful thug. And her frisky grandparents? Well, they're still &NFi;very&NFi_; much in love -- and aren't all that discreet about it!
link.title: synopsis
My Big Phat Hip Hop Family
Black Woman's Guide to Getting Married
Soul Theater Series: The Fabric of a Man
The Big Black Comedy Show: Vol. 2

link.synopsis: This gay romantic comedy stars Sean Tataryn as 18-year-old would-be poet Kyle, who -- tired of his superficial West Hollywood friends -- moves to the arty Silver Lake area of Los Angeles looking for love. Kyle finds his way to a funky neighborhood café, where he works on his verse -- and soon meets a handsome 30-year-old carpenter (Christopher Bradley). Can Kyle turn their one-night stand into a monogamous relationship?
link.title: synopsis
Eating Out: All You Can Eat
The Ultimate Lesbian Short Film Festival
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

link.synopsis: Eve Peabody has just arrived in Paris with only the gown on her back. So what's a girl to do? Pretend to be Hungarian baroness, of course! Claudette Colbert stars as the lovely lass who ditches a smitten cabbie (Don Ameche) to crash a regal affair. There, she meets the aristocratic John Barrymore, who gives her a royal disguise and hires her to lure away his cheating wife's lover. The result is a classic screwball comedy with a touch of romance.

I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife

link.synopsis: Claudette Colbert and Fred MacMurray headline this pair of comedy classics from the 1940s: No Time for Love, the tale of an unlikely romance, and The Egg and I, a fish-out-of-water rib-tickler inspired by a true story. In the first, photographer Colbert falls for laborer MacMurray on an unglamorous assignment. Then, the pair plays a city couple who buy a chicken farm on a whim. Marjorie Main and Percy Kilbride co-star, debuting as Ma and Pa Kettle.
link.title: synopsis
The Adventures of Ma & Pa Kettle: Vol. 1

link.synopsis: Newly single and without any friends to hang with, trust fund-supported slacker Nick (Hugh Dancy) begins coaching a youth soccer team. As he forges meaningful relationships with his star player and a new girlfriend (Liane Balaban), Nick finally starts learning how to grow up. Set in New York City, this charming romantic comedy about finding direction in life also features Gillian Jacobs, David Zayas and Mamie Gummer.
link.title: synopsis
It's Kind of a Funny Story
In the Hands of the Gods

link.synopsis: While preparing to interview renowned French filmmaker and self-proclaimed romance expert Thierry Grimandi (Eric Cantona), London journalist Jed (Hugh Bonneville) struggles to hang on to his longtime girlfriend, Cheryl (Victoria Hamilton), and comprehend the true meaning of love. Directed by Jackie Oudney, this romantic comedy waxes philosophic on the stark differences between French and British approaches to relationships.
link.title: synopsis
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
Once Upon a Time in the Midlands
Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason

link.synopsis: Coaxed by a friend, children's author Joe Peterson (Ross Partridge) -- who's suffering from writer's block -- heads to wintry Wisconsin to focus on his new book and to take a dip in Lake Michigan as part of the annual Polar Bear Plunge. But when he unexpectedly finds love with bubbly waitress Sif Andersen (Kathryn Aselton), Joe runs afoul of the town sheriff -- who happens to be Sif's father. Barry Corbin co-stars in this delightful indie comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay

link.synopsis: Forged during the golden era of vaudeville and silent-screen slapstick, comedy duo Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy became one of the few teams to successfully transition to the more rigorous demands of talkies. This vintage collection includes several shorts, ranging from silent classics such as Mud & Sand (1922), The Soilers (1923) and Short Kilts (1924) to World War II fare for the troops such as The Tree in a Test Tube (1943).

Make 'Em Laugh: The Funny Business of America

link.synopsis: Director and co-writer Arthur Borman takes aim at the world of low-budget moviemaking in this irreverent mockumentary that follows the efforts of a fictitious B-grade filmmaker to bring a sprawling biblical epic to the big screen. The This Is Spinal Tap-style comedy stars Stephen Rappaport and Michael Riley, with cameo appearances by Soupy Sales, Eve Plumb and Lou Ferrigno.
link.title: synopsis
Glick Doesn't Do Red Carpet: Jiminy Glick at the Independent Spirit Awards
Lord, Save Us from Your Followers
Mating Habits of the Earthbound Human

link.synopsis: To beautify his street and trim city spending, stuffy councilman Jack (Francis Matthews) pushes to have the last gas lamp in town removed. But this angers his neighbors Albert (Ian Fleming) and Victoria (Amy Dalby), an inconspicuous pair of serial killers who choose Jack as their next victim. This dark comedy also stars Lisa Daniely as Mary, a local advocate who fights tooth and nail against Jack's modernization efforts.
link.title: synopsis
The Wrong Arm of the Law
A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series
The Knack...and How to Get It

link.synopsis: A botched experiment in virtual reality transmits the soul of infamous British occultist Aleister Crowley into the body of shy professor Haddo (Simon Callow), whose life quickly descends into a maelstrom of sex, violence and depraved behavior. Eager to foil Haddo's satanic efforts is handsome physicist Dr. Joshua Mathers (Kal Weber). Iron Maiden vocalist Bruce Dickinson co-wrote the screenplay for this supernatural thriller.

Masters of Horror: William Malone: Fair Haired Child

link.synopsis: Singing sensation Tito Guízar stars in this screwball comedy as Miguel Soares, the object of famed writer Nicky Henderson's (Virginia Bruce) desire. Miguel decides to answer the question Nicky poses in her newest book, &NFi;Why Marry a Latin?&NFi_; Their affair blazes up Rio De Janeiro while Everett St. John Everett (Edward Everett Horton) is the meddler who means well. Joseph Santley directs.

Beats of the Heart: Spirit of Samba: Black Music of Brazil

link.synopsis: Fear grips idyllic suburbia as a syndrome turns loving moms into cold killers in this outrageous social comedy. Laurie Shallot (Kim Gillingham) and Peter Cochran (Christopher Coulson) have the cure, but can they save the interned mothers before the town banishes moms forever? As others are paid to do "mom" work, the economy flourishes, and corporate boss Mr. Brand (Keith Mills) is out to stop Laurie and Peter in the name of profits.

How to Be a Serial Killer
